verses.text: And the \sc Lord\sc* spake unto Moses, saying,
Speak unto Aaron, and unto his sons, and unto all the children of Israel, and say unto them; This \add is\add* the thing which the \sc Lord\sc* hath commanded, saying,
What man soever \add there be\add* of the house of Israel, that killeth an ox, or lamb, or goat, in the camp, or that killeth \add it\add* out of the camp,

and bringeth it not unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, to offer an offering unto the \sc Lord\sc* before the tabernacle of the \sc Lord\sc*; blood shall be imputed unto that man; he hath shed blood; and that man shall be cut off from among his people:

to the end that the children of Israel may bring their sacrifices, which they offer in the open field, even that they may bring them unto the \sc Lord\sc*, unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, unto the priest, and offer them \add for\add* peace offerings unto the \sc Lord\sc*.
And the priest shall sprinkle the blood upon the altar of the \sc Lord\sc* \add at\add* the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and burn the fat for a sweet savour unto the \sc Lord\sc*.
And they shall no more offer their sacrifices unto devils, after whom they have gone a whoring. This shall be a statute for ever unto them throughout their generations.
And thou shalt say unto them, Whatsoever man \add there be\add* of the house of Israel, or of the strangers which sojourn among you, that offereth a burnt offering or sacrifice,
and bringeth it not unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, to offer it unto the \sc Lord\sc*; even that man shall be cut off from among his people.

And whatsoever man \add there be\add* of the house of Israel, or of the strangers that sojourn among you, that eateth any \add manner of\add* blood; I will even set my face against \add that\add* soul that eateth blood, and will cut him off from among his people.

For the life of the flesh \add is\add* in the blood: and I have given it to you upon the altar to make an atonement for your souls: for it \add is\add* the blood \add that\add* maketh an atonement for the soul.
Therefore I said unto the children of Israel, No soul of you shall eat blood, neither shall any stranger that sojourneth among you eat blood.

And whatsoever man \add there be\add* of the children of Israel, or of the strangers that sojourn among you, which hunteth and catcheth \add any\add* beast or fowl that may be eaten; he shall even pour out the blood thereof, and cover it with dust.

For \add it is\add* the life of all flesh; the blood of it \add is\add* for the life thereof: therefore I said unto the children of Israel, Ye shall eat the blood of no \add manner of\add* flesh: for the life of all flesh \add is\add* the blood thereof: whosoever eateth it shall be cut off.

And every soul that eateth that which died of itself, or that which was torn \add with beasts, whether it be\add* one of your own country, or a stranger, he shall both wash his clothes, and bathe \add himself\add* in water, and be unclean until the even: then shall he be clean.
But if he wash \add them\add* not, nor bathe his flesh; then he shall bear his iniquity.
